intro: Batrachium heterophyllum subsp. triphyllum, commonly known as the three-leaf buttercup, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It is native to regions of North America, particularly in the eastern United States. This herbaceous plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
